intro: Hedypnois monspeliensis, commonly known as the Monspeliensis orchid, is a terrestrial orchid species native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its slender, leafy stems and produces small, greenish-white flowers with a distinctive yellow lip. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and prefers well-drained soil. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in Mediterranean regions. Hedypnois monspeliensis is a rare and endangered species, requiring specific environmental conditions for successful growth.
